sources: ['US20010003121A1', '2-(2,5-Dihydroxyphenylthio)-N-(tricyclo[3.3.1.13,7]dec-1-ylmethyl)-3-pyridine carboxamide', '0357', 'To a solution of the dimethoxy compound from Example 37 (1.0 g) in dichloromethane (20 ml) at −78° C., was added boron tribromide (5.5 ml of a 1M solution in dichloromethane. The reaction mixture was stirred for 24 hours, warming to ambient temperature. Methanol (5 ml) was added and the solvent was removed under reduced pressure and the residue purified by silica gel chromatography eluting with dichloromethane, ethyl acetate, acetic acid (4:1:0.1). The fractions containing product were combined and the solvent removed under reduced pressure to give the title compound as a white solid (0.40 g).']
stages: ['step 1:To a solution of the dimethoxy compound from Example 37 (1.0 g) in dichloromethane (20 ml) at −78° C., was added boron tribromide (5.5 ml of a 1M solution in dichloromethane', 'step 1 properties:Temperature:-78', 'step 2:The reaction mixture was stirred for 24 hours', 'step 2 properties:Time:86400', 'step 3:warming to ambient temperature', 'step 3 properties:Temperature:room temperature', 'step 4:Methanol (5 ml) was added', 'step 5:the solvent was removed under reduced pressure', 'step 5 properties:Pressure:reduced pressure', 'step 6:the residue purified by silica gel chromatography', 'step 7:eluting with dichloromethane, ethyl acetate, acetic acid (4:1:0.1)', 'step 8:The fractions containing product', 'step 9:the solvent removed under reduced pressure', 'step 9 properties:Pressure:reduced pressure', 'step 10:to give the title compound as a white solid (0.40 g)']

sources: ['US20010003121A1', 'a) 3,5-Dimethoxy-2-methylbenzoic acid', '0479', 'Solid methyl 3,5-dimethoxy-2-methylbenzoate (5.83 g, J. C. S. Perkin 1, 1973, 2853) was dissolved in methanol (80 ml). A solution of aqueous sodium hydroxide (10%, 80 ml) was added and the solution stirred at room temperature for 1 hour. The reaction was then concentrated under reduced pressure to approximately half of the original volume before adding aqueous hydrochloric acid (200 ml). The white precipitate that formed was extracted with ethyl acetate (2×250 ml). The combined extracts were dried over anhydrous magnesium sulphate, filtered and concentrated under reduced pressure to give the sub-title compound as a colourless solid (5.41 g).']
stages: ['step 1:Solid methyl 3,5-dimethoxy-2-methylbenzoate (5.83 g, J. C. S. Perkin 1, 1973, 2853) was dissolved in methanol (80 ml)', 'step 2:A solution of aqueous sodium hydroxide (10%, 80 ml) was added', 'step 3:the solution stirred at room temperature for 1 hour', 'step 3 properties:Time:3600', 'step 3 properties:Temperature:room temperature', 'step 4:The reaction was then concentrated under reduced pressure to approximately half of the original volume', 'step 4 properties:Pressure:reduced pressure', 'step 5:before adding aqueous hydrochloric acid (200 ml)', 'step 6:The white precipitate that formed', 'step 7:was extracted with ethyl acetate (2×250 ml)', 'step 8:The combined extracts were dried over anhydrous magnesium sulphate', 'step 9:filtered', 'step 10:concentrated under reduced pressure', 'step 10 properties:Pressure:reduced pressure', 'step 11:to give the sub-title compound as a colourless solid (5.41 g)']

sources: ['US20010003121A1', 'a) 2-Chloro-3-(2-chloroethyl)amino-N-(tricyclo[3.3.1.13,7]dec-1-ylmethyl)-benzamide', '0533', 'Prepared according to the method described in Example 63 from 3- amino-2-chloro-N-(tricyclo[3.3.1.13,7]dec-1-yl)methylbenzamide from Example 54 (0.7 g), 50% chloroacetaldehyde in water (0.353 ml), sodium cyanoborohydride (0.159 g), 50% hydrochloric acid in methanol (0.385 ml) and methanol (10 ml), giving the subtitled compound as a white solid (0.777 g) after purification by flash column chromatography eluting with 3:1 iso-hexane:ethylacetate.']
stages: ['step 1:Prepared', 'step 2:methanol (10 ml), giving the subtitled compound as a white solid (0.777 g)']
